securityAdvisory.description:
Versions of `tar` prior to 4.4.2 for 4.x and 2.2.2 for 2.x are vulnerable to Arbitrary File Overwrite. Extracting tarballs containing a hardlink to a file that already exists in the system, and a file that matches the hardlink will overwrite the system's file with the contents of the extracted file.


## Recommendation

For tar 4.x, upgrade to version 4.4.2 or later.
For tar 2.x, upgrade to version 2.2.2 or later.

Versions of `fstream` prior to 1.0.12 are vulnerable to Arbitrary File Overwrite. Extracting tarballs containing a hardlink to a file that already exists in the system and a file that matches the hardlink will overwrite the system's file with the contents of the extracted file. The `fstream.DirWriter()` function is vulnerable.


## Recommendation

Upgrade to version 1.0.12 or later.

Versions of `lodash` before 4.17.12 are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution.  The function `defaultsDeep` allows a malicious user to modify the prototype of `Object` via `{constructor: {prototype: {...}}}` causing the addition or modification of an existing property that will exist on all objects.




## Recommendation

Update to version 4.17.12 or later.

Versions of `lodash` before 4.17.12 are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution.  The function `defaultsDeep` allows a malicious user to modify the prototype of `Object` via `{constructor: {prototype: {...}}}` causing the addition or modification of an existing property that will exist on all objects.




## Recommendation

Update to version 4.17.12 or later.

Versions of `lodash` before 4.17.12 are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution.  The function `defaultsDeep` allows a malicious user to modify the prototype of `Object` via `{constructor: {prototype: {...}}}` causing the addition or modification of an existing property that will exist on all objects.




## Recommendation

Update to version 4.17.12 or later.

Versions of `mixin-deep` prior to 2.0.1 or 1.3.2 are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution. The `mixinDeep` function fails to validate which Object properties it updates. This allows attackers to modify the prototype of Object, causing the addition or modification of an existing property on all objects.




## Recommendation

If you are using `mixin-deep` 2.x, upgrade to version 2.0.1 or later.
If you are using `mixin-deep` 1.x, upgrade to version 1.3.2 or later.

Versions of `set-value` prior to 3.0.1 or 2.0.1 are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution. The `set` function fails to validate which Object properties it updates. This allows attackers to modify the prototype of Object, causing the addition or modification of an existing property on all objects.




## Recommendation

If you are using `set-value` 3.x, upgrade to version 3.0.1 or later.
If you are using `set-value` 2.x, upgrade to version 2.0.1 or later.

Versions of `lodash.mergewith` before 4.6.2 are vulnerable to prototype pollution. The function `mergeWith` may allow a malicious user to modify the prototype of `Object` via `{constructor: {prototype: {...}}}` causing the addition or modification of an existing property that will exist on all objects.




## Recommendation

Update to version 4.6.2 or later.

Versions of `http-proxy` prior to 1.18.1 are vulnerable to Denial of Service. An HTTP request with a long body triggers an `ERR_HTTP_HEADERS_SENT` unhandled exception that crashes the proxy server. This is only possible when the proxy server sets headers in the proxy request using the `proxyReq.setHeader` function.   

For a proxy server running on `http://localhost:3000`, the following curl request triggers the unhandled exception:  
```curl -XPOST http://localhost:3000 -d "$(python -c 'print("x"*1025)')"```


## Recommendation

Upgrade to version 1.18.1 or later

Versions of `kind-of` 6.x prior to 6.0.3 are vulnerable to a Validation Bypass. A maliciously crafted object can alter the result of the type check, allowing attackers to bypass the type checking validation. 


## Recommendation

Upgrade to versions 6.0.3 or later.

Affected versions of `minimist` are vulnerable to prototype pollution. Arguments are not properly sanitized, allowing an attacker to modify the prototype of `Object`, causing the addition or modification of an existing property that will exist on all objects.  
Parsing the argument `--__proto__.y=Polluted` adds a `y` property with value `Polluted` to all objects. The argument `--__proto__=Polluted` raises and uncaught error and crashes the application.  
This is exploitable if attackers have control over the arguments being passed to `minimist`.



## Recommendation

Upgrade to versions 0.2.1, 1.2.3 or later.

Versions of lodash prior to 4.17.19 are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution. The function zipObjectDeep allows a malicious user to modify the prototype of Object if the property identifiers are user-supplied. Being affected by this issue requires zipping objects based on user-provided property arrays.

This vulnerability causes the addition or modification of an existing property that will exist on all objects and may lead to Denial of Service or Code Execution under specific circumstances.

Affected versions of `node-sass` are vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS). Crafted objects passed to the `renderSync` function may trigger C++ assertions in `CustomImporterBridge::get_importer_entry` and `CustomImporterBridge::post_process_return_value` that crash the Node process. This may allow attackers to crash the system's running Node process and lead to Denial of Service.


## Recommendation

Upgrade to version 4.13.1 or later

Affected versions of `yargs-parser` are vulnerable to prototype pollution. Arguments are not properly sanitized, allowing an attacker to modify the prototype of `Object`, causing the addition or modification of an existing property that will exist on all objects.  
Parsing the argument `--foo.__proto__.bar baz'` adds a `bar` property with value `baz` to all objects. This is only exploitable if attackers have control over the arguments being passed to `yargs-parser`.



## Recommendation

Upgrade to versions 13.1.2, 15.0.1, 18.1.1 or later.

securityAdvisory.summary: Moderate severity vulnerability that affects bootstrap and bootstrap-sass
securityAdvisory.description: In Bootstrap 4 before 4.3.1 and Bootstrap 3 before 3.4.1, XSS is possible in the tooltip or popover data-template attribute. For more information, see: https://blog.getbootstrap.com/2019/02/13/bootstrap-4-3-1-and-3-4-1/

Versions of `axios` prior to 0.18.1 are vulnerable to Denial of Service. If a request exceeds the `maxContentLength` property, the package prints an error but does not stop the request. This may cause high CPU usage and lead to Denial of Service.


## Recommendation

Upgrade to 0.18.1 or later.

rules.name: java/unsafe-deserialization
rules.description: Deserializing user-controlled data may allow attackers to execute arbitrary code.

rules.name: java/ldap-injection
rules.shortDescription: LDAP query built from user-controlled sources
rules.description: Building an LDAP query from user-controlled sources is vulnerable to insertion of malicious LDAP code by the user.

rules.name: java/xss
rules.description: Writing user input directly to a web page allows for a cross-site scripting vulnerability.

rules.name: java/insecure-cookie
rules.description: Insecure cookies may be sent in cleartext, which makes them vulnerable to interception.

rules.name: java/maven/non-https-url
rules.shortDescription: Failure to use HTTPS or SFTP URL in Maven artifact upload/download
rules.description: Non-HTTPS connections can be intercepted by third parties.

rules.name: java/tainted-format-string
rules.description: Using external input in format strings can lead to exceptions or information leaks.

rules.name: java/sql-injection
rules.description: Building a SQL or Java Persistence query from user-controlled sources is vulnerable to insertion of malicious code by the user.

rules.name: java/concatenated-sql-query
rules.shortDescription: Query built without neutralizing special characters
rules.description: Building a SQL or Java Persistence query without escaping or otherwise neutralizing any special characters is vulnerable to insertion of malicious code.

rules.name: java/tainted-numeric-cast
rules.description: Casting user-controlled numeric data to a narrower type without validation can cause unexpected truncation.

rules.name: java/tainted-permissions-check
rules.shortDescription: User-controlled data used in permissions check
rules.description: Using user-controlled data in a permissions check may result in inappropriate permissions being granted.

rules.name: java/spring-disabled-csrf-protection
rules.description: Disabling CSRF protection makes the application vulnerable to a Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) attack.

rules.name: java/cleartext-storage-in-cookie
rules.shortDescription: Cleartext storage of sensitive information in cookie
rules.description: Storing sensitive information in cleartext can expose it to an attacker.

rules.name: java/unvalidated-url-redirection
rules.description: URL redirection based on unvalidated user-input may cause redirection to malicious web sites.

rules.name: java/stack-trace-exposure
rules.shortDescription: Information exposure through a stack trace
rules.description: Information from a stack trace propagates to an external user. Stack traces can unintentionally reveal implementation details that are useful to an attacker for developing a subsequent exploit.

rules.name: java/netty-http-response-splitting
rules.description: Disabling HTTP header validation makes code vulnerable to attack by header splitting if user input is written directly to an HTTP header.

rules.name: java/http-response-splitting
rules.description: Writing user input directly to an HTTP header makes code vulnerable to attack by header splitting.

rules.name: java/zipslip
rules.shortDescription: Arbitrary file write during archive extraction ("Zip Slip")
rules.description: Extracting files from a malicious archive without validating that the destination file path is within the destination directory can cause files outside the destination directory to be overwritten.

rules.name: java/path-injection
rules.shortDescription: Uncontrolled data used in path expression
rules.description: Accessing paths influenced by users can allow an attacker to access unexpected resources.

rules.name: java/predictable-seed
rules.shortDescription: Use of a predictable seed in a secure random number generator
rules.description: Using a predictable seed in a pseudo-random number generator can lead to predictability of the numbers generated by it.

rules.name: java/command-line-injection
rules.description: Using externally controlled strings in a command line is vulnerable to malicious changes in the strings.

rules.name: java/concatenated-command-line
rules.shortDescription: Building a command line with string concatenation
rules.description: Using concatenated strings in a command line is vulnerable to malicious insertion of special characters in the strings.

rules.name: java/world-writable-file-read
rules.shortDescription: Reading from a world writable file
rules.description: Reading from a file which is set as world writable is dangerous because the file may be modified or removed by external actors.

rules.name: java/xxe
rules.shortDescription: Resolving XML external entity in user-controlled data
rules.description: Parsing user-controlled XML documents and allowing expansion of external entity references may lead to disclosure of confidential data or denial of service.

rules.name: java/implicit-cast-in-compound-assignment
rules.shortDescription: Implicit narrowing conversion in compound assignment
rules.description: Compound assignment statements (for example 'intvar += longvar') that implicitly cast a value of a wider type to a narrower type may result in information loss and numeric errors such as overflows.

rules.name: java/integer-multiplication-cast-to-long
rules.shortDescription: Result of multiplication cast to wider type
rules.description: Casting the result of a multiplication to a wider type instead of casting before the multiplication may cause overflow.

rules.name: java/useless-null-check
rules.description: Checking whether an expression is null when that expression cannot possibly be null is useless.

rules.name: java/iterable-wraps-iterator
rules.description: An 'Iterable' that reuses an 'Iterator' instance does not support multiple traversals and can lead to unexpected behavior.

rules.name: java/iterator-implements-iterable
rules.description: An 'Iterator' that also implements 'Iterable' by returning itself as its 'Iterator' does not support multiple traversals. This can lead to unexpected behavior when it is viewed as an 'Iterable'.

rules.name: java/chained-type-tests
rules.description: Long sequences of type tests on a variable are difficult to maintain.

rules.name: java/useless-type-test
rules.description: Testing whether a derived type is an instance of its base type is unnecessary.

rules.name: java/unknown-javadoc-parameter
rules.description: Javadoc @param tags that do not match any parameters in the method or constructor are confusing.

rules.name: java/inconsistent-javadoc-throws
rules.description: Javadoc that incorrectly claims a method or constructor can throw an exception is misleading.

rules.name: java/deprecated-call
rules.description: Using a method or constructor that has been marked as deprecated may be dangerous or fail to take advantage of a better method or constructor.

rules.name: java/missing-override-annotation
rules.description: A method that overrides a method in a superclass but does not have an 'Override' annotation cannot take advantage of compiler checks, and makes code less readable.

rules.name: java/unused-parameter
rules.description: Parameters that are not used add unnecessary complexity to an interface.

rules.name: java/inefficient-empty-string-test
rules.description: Checking a string for equality with an empty string is inefficient.

rules.name: java/inefficient-boxed-constructor
rules.description: Calling the constructor of a boxed type is inefficient.

rules.name: java/inefficient-string-constructor
rules.description: Using the 'String(String)' constructor is less memory efficient than using the constructor argument directly.

rules.name: java/non-static-nested-class
rules.description: A non-static nested class keeps a reference to the enclosing object, which makes the nested class bigger and may cause a memory leak.

rules.name: java/inefficient-output-stream
rules.description: Using the default implementation of 'write(byte[],int,int)' provided by 'java.io.OutputStream' is very inefficient.

rules.name: java/inefficient-key-set-iterator
rules.shortDescription: Inefficient use of key set iterator
rules.description: Iterating through the values of a map using the key set is inefficient.

rules.name: java/duplicate-class
rules.description: Classes in which most of the methods are duplicated in another class make code more difficult to understand and introduce a risk of changes being made to only one copy.

rules.name: java/duplicate-method
rules.description: Duplicated methods make code more difficult to understand and introduce a risk of changes being made to only one copy.

rules.name: java/similar-method
rules.description: Methods in which most of the lines are duplicated in another method make code more difficult to understand and introduce a risk of changes being made to only one copy.

rules.name: java/duplicate-anonymous-class
rules.description: Duplicated anonymous classes indicate that refactoring is necessary.

rules.name: java/similar-file
rules.description: Files in which most of the lines are similar to those in another file make code more difficult to understand and introduce a risk of changes being made to only one copy.

rules.name: java/duplicate-file
rules.description: Files in which most of the lines are duplicated in another file make code more difficult to understand and introduce a risk of changes being made to only one copy.

rules.name: java/print-array
rules.shortDescription: Implicit conversion from array to string
rules.description: Directly printing an array, without first converting the array to a string, produces unreadable results.

rules.name: java/useless-tostring-call
rules.description: Calling 'toString' on a string is redundant.

rules.name: java/call-to-object-tostring
rules.description: Calling the default implementation of 'toString' returns a value that is unlikely to be what you expect.

rules.name: java/local-shadows-field
rules.shortDescription: Possible confusion of local and field
rules.description: A method in which a variable is declared with the same name as a field is difficult to understand.

rules.name: java/confusing-method-signature
rules.description: Overloaded methods that have the same number of parameters, where each pair of corresponding parameter types is convertible by casting or autoboxing, may be confusing.

rules.name: java/class-name-matches-super-class
rules.shortDescription: Class has same name as super class
rules.description: A class that has the same name as its superclass may be confusing.

rules.name: java/confusing-method-name
rules.shortDescription: Confusing method names because of capitalization
rules.description: Methods in the same class whose names differ only in capitalization are confusing.

rules.name: java/subtle-inherited-call
rules.description: An unqualified call to a method that exists with the same signature in both a superclass and an outer class is ambiguous.

rules.name: java/uncaught-number-format-exception
rules.description: Calling a string to number conversion method without handling 'NumberFormatException' may cause unexpected runtime exceptions.

rules.name: java/ignored-error-status-of-call
rules.description: Ignoring an exceptional value that is returned by a method may cause subsequent code to fail.

rules.name: java/constants-only-interface
rules.description: Implementing an interface (or extending an abstract class) only to put a number of constant definitions into scope is considered bad practice.

rules.name: java/unused-reference-type
rules.description: A non-public class or interface that is not used anywhere in the program wastes programmer resources.

rules.name: java/local-variable-is-never-read
rules.description: A local variable that is never read is redundant.

rules.name: java/unused-label
rules.description: An unused label for a loop or 'switch' statement is either redundant or indicates incorrect 'break' or 'continue' statements.

rules.name: java/unimplementable-interface
rules.description: An interface method that is incompatible with a protected method on 'java.lang.Object' means that the interface cannot be implemented.

rules.name: java/abstract-to-concrete-cast
rules.shortDescription: Cast from abstract to concrete collection
rules.description: A cast from an abstract collection to a concrete implementation type makes the code brittle.

rules.name: java/internal-representation-exposure
rules.description: An object that accidentally exposes its internal representation may allow the object's fields to be modified in ways that the object is not prepared to handle.

rules.name: java/non-null-boxed-variable
rules.description: Using a boxed type for a variable that is never assigned 'null' hinders readability because it implies that 'null' is a potential value.

rules.name: java/jdk-internal-api-access
rules.description: Use of unsupported JDK-internal APIs may cause compatibility issues when upgrading to newer versions of Java, in particular Java 9.

rules.name: java/underscore-identifier
rules.description: Use of a single underscore character as an identifier results in a compiler error with Java source level 9 or later.

rules.name: java/non-final-call-in-constructor
rules.description: If a constructor calls a method that is overridden in a subclass, the result can be unpredictable.

rules.name: java/equals-on-arrays
rules.description: The 'equals' and 'hashCode' methods on arrays only consider object identity, not array contents, which is unlikely to be what is intended.

rules.name: java/hashing-without-hashcode
rules.description: Classes that define an 'equals' method but no 'hashCode' method, and whose instances are stored in a hashing data structure, can lead to unexpected results.

rules.name: java/comparison-of-identical-expressions
rules.description: If the same expression occurs on both sides of a comparison operator, the operator is redundant, and probably indicates a mistake.

rules.name: java/equals-on-unrelated-types
rules.description: Calls of the form 'x.equals(y)', where the types of 'x' and 'y' are incomparable, should always return 'false'.

rules.name: java/constant-comparison
rules.description: A comparison operation that always evaluates to true or always evaluates to false may indicate faulty logic and may result in dead code.

rules.name: java/comparison-with-nan
rules.description: A comparison with 'NaN' using '==' or '!=' will always yield the same result and is unlikely to be intended.

rules.name: java/inconsistent-equals-and-hashcode
rules.description: If a class overrides only one of 'equals' and 'hashCode', it may mean that 'equals' and 'hashCode' are inconsistent.

rules.name: java/unchecked-cast-in-equals
rules.shortDescription: Equals method does not inspect argument type
rules.description: An implementation of 'equals' that does not check the type of its argument may lead to failing casts.

rules.name: java/reference-equality-of-boxed-types
rules.shortDescription: Reference equality test of boxed types
rules.description: Comparing two boxed primitive values using the == or != operator compares object identity, which may not be intended.

rules.name: java/misleading-indentation
rules.description: If a control structure does not use braces, misleading indentation makes it difficult to see which statements are within its scope.

rules.name: java/unreachable-catch-clause
rules.description: An unreachable 'catch' clause may indicate a mistake in exception handling or may be unnecessary.

rules.name: java/continue-in-false-loop
rules.shortDescription: Continue statement that does not continue
rules.description: A 'continue' statement only re-runs the loop if the loop-condition is true. Therefore using 'continue' in a loop with a constant false condition is misleading and usually a bug.

rules.name: java/constant-loop-condition
rules.description: A loop condition that remains constant throughout the iteration indicates faulty logic and is likely to cause infinite looping.

rules.name: java/evaluation-to-constant
rules.shortDescription: Expression always evaluates to the same value
rules.description: An expression that always evaluates to the same value, but which has a non-constant subexpression, indicates a mistake.

rules.name: java/whitespace-contradicts-precedence
rules.description: Nested expressions where the formatting contradicts the grouping enforced by operator precedence are difficult to read and may even indicate a bug.

rules.name: java/lshift-larger-than-type-width
rules.shortDescription: Left shift by more than the type width
rules.description: Left-shifting an integer by more than its type width indicates a mistake.

rules.name: java/index-out-of-bounds
rules.description: Accessing an array with an index that is greater than or equal to the length of the array causes an 'ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException'.

rules.name: java/type-mismatch-modification
rules.description: Calling container modification methods such as 'Collection.remove' or 'Map.remove' with an object of a type that is incompatible with the corresponding container element type is unlikely to have any effect.

rules.name: java/empty-container
rules.description: Querying the contents of a collection or map that is never initialized is not normally useful.

rules.name: java/unused-container
rules.description: A collection or map whose contents are never queried or accessed is useless.

rules.name: java/type-mismatch-access
rules.description: Calling container access methods such as 'Collection.contains' or 'Map.get' with an object of a type that is incompatible with the corresponding container element type is unlikely to return 'true'.

rules.name: java/contradictory-type-checks
rules.description: Contradictory dynamic type checks in `instanceof` expressions and casts may cause dead code or even runtime errors, and usually indicate a logic error.

rules.name: java/test-for-negative-container-size
rules.description: Comparing the size of a container to zero with this operator will always return the same value.

rules.name: java/string-buffer-char-init
rules.shortDescription: Character passed to StringBuffer or StringBuilder constructor
rules.description: A character value is passed to the constructor of 'StringBuffer' or 'StringBuilder'. This value will be converted to an integer and interpreted as the buffer's initial capacity, which is probably not intended.

rules.name: java/missing-format-argument
rules.description: A format call with an insufficient number of arguments causes an 'IllegalFormatException'.

rules.name: java/missing-space-in-concatenation
rules.description: Joining strings at compile-time to construct a string literal so that two words are concatenated without a separating space usually indicates a text error.

rules.name: java/redundant-assignment
rules.description: Assigning a variable to itself has no effect.

rules.name: java/suspicious-date-format
rules.description: Using a data format that includes both 'M' and 'Y' is likely to give unexpected results.

rules.name: java/unused-format-argument
rules.description: A format call with a format string that refers to fewer arguments than the number of supplied arguments will silently ignore the additional arguments.

rules.name: java/output-resource-leak
rules.description: A resource that is opened for writing but not closed may cause a resource leak.

rules.name: java/database-resource-leak
rules.description: A database resource that is opened but not closed may cause a resource leak.

rules.name: java/input-resource-leak
rules.description: A resource that is opened for reading but not closed may cause a resource leak.

rules.name: java/dereferenced-expr-may-be-null
rules.description: Dereferencing an expression whose value may be 'null' may cause a 'NullPointerException'.

rules.name: java/dereferenced-value-may-be-null
rules.description: Dereferencing a variable whose value may be 'null' may cause a 'NullPointerException'.

rules.name: java/dereferenced-value-is-always-null
rules.description: Dereferencing a variable whose value is 'null' causes a 'NullPointerException'.

rules.name: java/unsafe-double-checked-locking
rules.description: A repeated check on a non-volatile field is not thread-safe, and could result in unexpected behavior.

rules.name: java/unsynchronized-getter
rules.shortDescription: Inconsistent synchronization of getter and setter
rules.description: If a class has a synchronized 'set' method, and a similarly-named 'get' method is not also synchronized, calls to the 'get' method may not return a consistent state for the object.

rules.name: java/unsafe-double-checked-locking-init-order
rules.shortDescription: Race condition in double-checked locking object initialization
rules.description: Performing additional initialization on an object after assignment to a shared variable guarded by double-checked locking is not thread-safe, and could result in unexpected behavior.

rules.name: java/sync-on-boxed-types
rules.shortDescription: Synchronization on boxed types or strings
rules.description: Synchronizing on boxed types or strings may lead to deadlock since an instance of that type is likely to be shared between many parts of the program.

rules.name: java/non-sync-override
rules.description: If a synchronized method is overridden in a subclass, and the overriding method is not synchronized, the thread-safety of the subclass may be broken.

rules.name: java/call-to-thread-run
rules.shortDescription: Direct call to a run() method
rules.description: Directly calling a 'Thread' object's 'run' method does not start a separate thread but executes the method within the current thread.

rules.name: java/type-variable-hides-type
rules.description: A type variable with the same name as another type that is in scope can cause the two types to be confused.

rules.name: java/type-bound-extends-final
rules.shortDescription: Type bound extends a final class
rules.description: If 'C' is a final class, a type bound such as '? extends C' is confusing because it implies that 'C' has subclasses, but a final class has no subclasses.

rules.name: java/non-overriding-package-private
rules.description: A method that appears to override another method but does not, because the declaring classes are in different packages, is potentially confusing.

rules.name: java/socket-auth-race-condition
rules.description: Opening a socket after authenticating via a different channel may allow an attacker to connect to the port first.

rules.name: java/unreachable-exit-in-loop
rules.description: An iteration or loop with an exit condition that cannot be reached is an indication of faulty logic and can likely lead to infinite looping.

rules.name: java/potentially-dangerous-function
rules.shortDescription: Use of a potentially dangerous function
rules.description: Certain standard library routines are dangerous to call.

rules.name: java/user-controlled-bypass
rules.description: User-controlled bypassing of sensitive methods may allow attackers to avoid passing through authentication systems.

rules.name: java/cleartext-storage-in-properties
rules.shortDescription: Cleartext storage of sensitive information using 'Properties' class
rules.description: Storing sensitive information in cleartext can expose it to an attacker.

rules.name: java/potentially-weak-cryptographic-algorithm
rules.shortDescription: Use of a potentially broken or risky cryptographic algorithm
rules.description: Using broken or weak cryptographic algorithms can allow an attacker to compromise security.

rules.name: java/weak-cryptographic-algorithm
rules.shortDescription: Use of a broken or risky cryptographic algorithm
rules.description: Using broken or weak cryptographic algorithms can allow an attacker to compromise security.

rules.name: java/tainted-arithmetic
rules.description: Arithmetic operations on user-controlled data that is not validated can cause overflows.

rules.name: java/comparison-with-wider-type
rules.shortDescription: Comparison of narrow type with wide type in loop condition
rules.description: Comparisons between types of different widths in a loop condition can cause the loop to behave unexpectedly.

rules.name: java/uncontrolled-arithmetic
rules.description: Arithmetic operations on uncontrolled data that is not validated can cause overflows.

rules.name: java/hardcoded-credential-api-call
rules.description: Using a hard-coded credential in a call to a sensitive Java API may compromise security.

rules.name: java/toctou-race-condition
rules.description: Using a resource after an unsynchronized state check can lead to a race condition, if the state may be changed between the check and use.

rules.name: java/relative-path-command
rules.shortDescription: Executing a command with a relative path
rules.description: Executing a command with a relative path is vulnerable to malicious changes in the PATH environment variable.

rules.name: java/improper-validation-of-array-index
rules.shortDescription: Improper validation of user-provided array index
rules.description: Using external input as an index to an array, without proper validation, can lead to index out of bound exceptions.

rules.name: java/improper-validation-of-array-construction
rules.shortDescription: Improper validation of user-provided size used for array construction
rules.description: Using unvalidated external input as the argument to a construction of an array can lead to index out of bound exceptions.

rules.name: java/iterator-hasnext-calls-next
rules.description: Iterator implementations whose 'hasNext' method calls 'next' are most likely incorrect.

rules.name: java/run-finalizers-on-exit
rules.description: Calling 'System.runFinalizersOnExit' or 'Runtime.runFinalizersOnExit' may cause finalizers to be run on live objects, leading to erratic behavior or deadlock.

rules.name: java/field-masks-super-field
rules.shortDescription: Field masks field in super class
rules.description: Hiding a field in a superclass by redeclaring it in a subclass might be unintentional, especially if references to the hidden field are not qualified using 'super'.

rules.name: java/empty-zip-file-entry
rules.description: Omitting a call to 'ZipOutputStream.write' when writing a ZIP file to an output stream means that an empty ZIP file entry is written.

rules.name: java/unsafe-get-resource
rules.description: Calling 'this.getClass().getResource()' may yield unexpected results if called from a subclass in another package.

rules.name: java/inconsistent-compareto-and-equals
rules.description: If a class overrides 'compareTo' but not 'equals', it may mean that 'compareTo' and 'equals' are inconsistent.

rules.name: java/wrong-compareto-signature
rules.description: Defining 'Comparable.compareTo', where the parameter of 'compareTo' is not of the appropriate type, overloads 'compareTo' instead of overriding it.

rules.name: java/wrong-equals-signature
rules.description: Defining 'Object.equals', where the parameter of 'equals' is not of the appropriate type, overloads 'equals' instead of overriding it.

rules.name: java/reference-equality-on-strings
rules.description: Comparing two strings using the == or != operator compares object identity, which may not be intended.

rules.name: java/wrong-junit-suite-signature
rules.description: A 'suite' method in a JUnit 3.8 test that does not match the expected signature is not detected by JUnit.

rules.name: java/wrong-swing-event-adapter-signature
rules.shortDescription: Bad implementation of an event Adapter
rules.description: In a class that extends a Swing or Abstract Window Toolkit event adapter, an event handler that does not have exactly the same name as the event handler that it overrides means that the overridden event handler is not called.

rules.name: java/missing-call-to-super-clone
rules.description: A 'clone' method that is overridden in a subclass, and that does not itself call 'super.clone', causes calls to the subclass's 'clone' method to return an object of the wrong type.

rules.name: java/missing-clone-method
rules.description: A class that implements 'Cloneable' but does not override the 'clone' method will have undesired behavior.

rules.name: java/missing-case-in-switch
rules.description: A 'switch' statement that is based on an 'enum' type and does not have cases for all the 'enum' constants is usually a coding mistake.

rules.name: java/spin-on-field
rules.description: Repeatedly reading a non-volatile field within the condition of an empty loop may result in an infinite loop.

rules.name: java/missing-super-finalize
rules.description: A 'finalize' method that does not call 'super.finalize' may leave cleanup actions undone.

rules.name: java/abs-of-random
rules.shortDescription: Incorrect absolute value of random number
rules.description: Calling 'Math.abs' to find the absolute value of a randomly generated integer is not guaranteed to return a non-negative integer.

rules.name: java/multiplication-of-remainder
rules.description: Using the remainder operator with the multiplication operator without adding parentheses to clarify precedence may cause confusion.

rules.name: java/random-used-once
rules.description: Creating an instance of 'Random' for each pseudo-random number required does not guarantee an evenly distributed sequence of random numbers.

rules.name: java/ineffective-annotation-present-check
rules.description: If an annotation has not been annotated with a 'RUNTIME' retention policy, checking for its presence at runtime is not possible.

rules.name: java/iterator-remove-failure
rules.description: Attempting to invoke 'Iterator.remove' on an iterator over a collection that does not support element removal causes a runtime exception.

rules.name: java/non-serializable-inner-class
rules.shortDescription: Serializable inner class of non-serializable class
rules.description: A class that is serializable with an enclosing class that is not serializable causes serialization to fail.

rules.name: java/missing-no-arg-constructor-on-serializable
rules.description: A non-serializable, immediate superclass of a serializable class that does not itself declare an accessible, no-argument constructor causes deserialization to fail.

rules.name: java/missing-no-arg-constructor-on-externalizable
rules.shortDescription: Externalizable but no public no-argument constructor
rules.description: A class that implements 'Externalizable' but does not have a public no-argument constructor causes an 'InvalidClassException' to be thrown.

rules.name: java/wrong-readresolve-signature
rules.shortDescription: ReadResolve must have Object return type, not void
rules.description: An implementation of 'readResolve' that does not have the signature that is expected by the Java serialization framework is not recognized by the serialization mechanism.

rules.name: java/wrong-object-serialization-signature
rules.shortDescription: Serialization methods do not match required signature
rules.description: A serialized class that implements 'readObject' or 'writeObject' but does not use the correct signatures causes the default serialization mechanism to be used.

rules.name: java/incorrect-serial-version-uid
rules.description: A 'serialVersionUID' field that is declared in a serializable class but is of the wrong type cannot be used by the serialization framework.

rules.name: java/tostring-typo
rules.description: A method named 'tostring' may be intended to be named 'toString'.

rules.name: java/non-short-circuit-evaluation
rules.description: Using a bitwise logical operator on a boolean where a conditional-and or conditional-or operator is intended may yield the wrong result or cause an exception.

rules.name: java/hashcode-typo
rules.description: A method named 'hashcode' may be intended to be named 'hashCode'.

rules.name: java/equals-typo
rules.description: A method named 'equal' may be intended to be named 'equals'.

rules.name: java/wait-on-condition-interface
rules.description: Calling 'wait' on a 'Condition' interface may result in unexpected behavior and is probably a typographical error.

rules.name: java/unreleased-lock
rules.description: A lock that is acquired one or more times without a matching number of unlocks may cause a deadlock.

rules.name: java/notify-instead-of-notify-all
rules.description: Calling 'notify' instead of 'notifyAll' may fail to wake up the correct thread and cannot wake up multiple threads.

rules.name: java/sleep-with-lock-held
rules.description: Calling 'Thread.sleep' with a lock held may lead to very poor performance or even deadlock.

rules.name: java/unsafe-sync-on-field
rules.description: Synchronizing on a field and updating that field while the lock is held is unlikely to provide the desired thread safety.

rules.name: java/thread-unsafe-dateformat
rules.description: Static fields of type 'DateFormat' (or its descendants) should be avoided because the class 'DateFormat' is not thread-safe.

rules.name: java/thread-start-in-constructor
rules.description: Starting a thread within a constructor may cause the thread to start before any subclass constructor has completed its initialization, causing unexpected results.

rules.name: java/inconsistent-sync-writeobject
rules.description: Classes with a synchronized 'writeObject' method but no other synchronized methods usually lack a sufficient level of synchronization.

error.name: Query built without neutralizing special characters

details.name: java/concatenated-sql-query
details.shortDescription: Query built without neutralizing special characters
details.description: Building a SQL or Java Persistence query without escaping or otherwise neutralizing any special characters is vulnerable to insertion of malicious code.

details.name: java/sql-injection
details.description: Building a SQL or Java Persistence query from user-controlled sources is vulnerable to insertion of malicious code by the user.

details.name: java/sql-injection
details.description: Building a SQL or Java Persistence query from user-controlled sources is vulnerable to insertion of malicious code by the user.

details.name: java/sql-injection
details.description: Building a SQL or Java Persistence query from user-controlled sources is vulnerable to insertion of malicious code by the user.

details.name: java/sql-injection
details.description: Building a SQL or Java Persistence query from user-controlled sources is vulnerable to insertion of malicious code by the user.

details.name: java/sql-injection
details.description: Building a SQL or Java Persistence query from user-controlled sources is vulnerable to insertion of malicious code by the user.

details.name: java/sql-injection
details.description: Building a SQL or Java Persistence query from user-controlled sources is vulnerable to insertion of malicious code by the user.

details.name: java/sql-injection
details.description: Building a SQL or Java Persistence query from user-controlled sources is vulnerable to insertion of malicious code by the user.

details.name: java/sql-injection
details.description: Building a SQL or Java Persistence query from user-controlled sources is vulnerable to insertion of malicious code by the user.

error.name: Query built without neutralizing special characters

details.name: java/concatenated-sql-query
details.shortDescription: Query built without neutralizing special characters
details.description: Building a SQL or Java Persistence query without escaping or otherwise neutralizing any special characters is vulnerable to insertion of malicious code.

details.name: java/insecure-cookie
details.description: Insecure cookies may be sent in cleartext, which makes them vulnerable to interception.

details.name: java/insecure-cookie
details.description: Insecure cookies may be sent in cleartext, which makes them vulnerable to interception.

error.name: Resolving XML external entity in user-controlled data

details.name: java/xxe
details.shortDescription: Resolving XML external entity in user-controlled data
details.description: Parsing user-controlled XML documents and allowing expansion of external entity references may lead to disclosure of confidential data or denial of service.

details.name: java/unsafe-deserialization
details.description: Deserializing user-controlled data may allow attackers to execute arbitrary code.

warning.name: Unsafe expansion of self-closing HTML tag
Unsafe expansion of self-closing HTML tag
